meanings.definition: To compare or examine two or more things in order to show similarities or differences.
meanings.sent1: She intercompared the two paintings to see which one had more colors.
meanings.sent2: The prices of the two laptops were intercompared to find the better deal.
meanings.sent3: The detective intercompared the footprints to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The teacher intercompared the students' test scores to identify areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: By intercomparing the ingredients, she realized she had forgotten to add salt to the recipe.

meanings.definition: To be compared or contrasted with one another.
meanings.sent1: The two cars intercompared in terms of fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The different fabrics intercompared when it came to durability.
meanings.sent3: The siblings intercompared their heights to see who was taller.
meanings.sent4: The flavors of the ice cream intercompared in a delightful way.
meanings.sent5: The buildings intercompared in size, with one towering over the other.
